result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. CZEKALA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Fulltime work or work search at discretion of the agent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with illicit drug users/dealers.

No contact with Cheree Heitz, Daniel Lisowski and Jennifer Diaz.  

DNA sample.
Pay restitution to Sadoff Iron and Metal.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence upon the completion of sentence in 15 CT 229.

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-15-15 at 10:00 a.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defense is requesting that the daily reporting condition be removed.  The defendant has the opportunity to enter treatment.  The Court will sign the appropriate order once the State is satisfied that the defendant is, in fact, in treatment.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.
Minutes.

Motion to Modify Bail.
Cover letter.
Marcus Falk, through public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  A Store, on 09-10-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of PTC armed robbery, obstruct officer and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department Monday through Friday by 4:30 p.m. and that he have no contact with Daniel Lisowski and with the A Store in Manitowoc WI or its premises.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
